item.title: #TIL 2018-01-30 : Using mark to bookmark checkpoints in files
item.description: Using mark to bookmark checkpoints in files Bookmarking a checkpoint will help you get back to it intermidately. Ex: your have to find some text to replace something but want to return back current position. Set a mark - [NORMAL MODE] , type m then follow by a letter from a-z (lowercase is filescope, uppercase for global scope - vim scope) Go to a mark - [NORMAL MODE] , type backstick ` then follow by the letter your marked above.
